recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom & Vegan Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy mushroom & vegan chicken with pasta sauce.
ingredients: 1 cup/100g Vegan ‘Chicken’ Pieces (optional – replace with chickpeas or beans)
2 Servings Cooked Pasta, of your choice
instructions: Place a non stick frying pan over a medium heat & add the oil.
When the pan is hot add shallot, garlic, mushrooms & vegan chicken.
Sauté the mix for 2-3 minutes until lovely & golden, then deglaze the pan with the white wine.
Let the wine bubble away for 30 seconds to cook off the alcohol then add the vegan cream & mustard & stir well.
Let the sauce bubble for a minute or so then season with salt & pepper + add the tarragon.
Stir through your cooked pasta & serve. I like to garnish with a few chilli flakes.

recipes.name: Creamy Bean Soup with Sausage
recipes.description: An ultra creamy bean soup with sausage. This soup isn’t one of those all day simmering affairs. So quick and easy to make, yet hearty and full of flavor. It’s rich and  tomatoey, jazzed up with Parmesan and topped with a delicious punchy, red pesto. A knock out 30 minute meal. Serve with a side of crusty bread for a mouthwatering result.
ingredients: 450 g Italian sausage mild or spicy, no casings
3 cans (360 g/13 oz) cannellini beans drained and rinsed
spices: ½ tsp crushed red pepper flakes
instructions: Get all the prep done before you start cooking: mince the garlic and finely chop the onion. Remove the casings from your sausage. Drain and rinse the beans.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium high. Add sausage, break up the meat into small pieces with a wooden spoon, and cook until browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and onion, cook until fragrant, for 3 minutes. Stir in spices, and cook for 1 minute more.
Pour in broth, add puréed tomatoes and tomato paste. Bring to a boil, then add cannellini beans. Stir, lower the heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring every now and then.
When ready, pour in cream and stir to combine. Turn off the heat and stir in Parmesan. Finish off with some extra black pepper and parsley. Adjust salt to taste.
Serve with crusty bread. Dollop each bowl with red pesto and some red pepper flakes. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Vegan Potato Salad
recipes.description: This vegan potato salad is creamy, wholesome, herby, zingy and refreshing! The recipe is gluten-free, oil-free and vegan (of course!). It's so easy to make and the ingredients are simple. Expect tender potatoes, with a creamy citrus dressing, fresh herbs and a little crunch from red onion and celery. Certainly, it’s the BEST vegan potato salad you’ll try.
ingredients: 907 g red potatoes cut into 1 ½ inch pieces
61 g lemon juice or apple cider vinegar
instructions: In a large pot add the chopped potatoes and sea salt. Fill with water to be 1-inch above the potatoes and bring to a boil on high-heat. Reduce to a simmer on medium-high heat and cook the potatoes until fork tender, about 5 minutes. Strain and rinse with cold water. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add the celery, red onion and dill.

In a small bowl, whisk together the Creamy Dressing: coconut yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, Dijon mustard, maple syrup, sea salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and stir to combine.
tips: Potato salad can be served immediately, or chill in the fridge until ready to eat.

I recommend using red potatoes for this recipe as they hold their shape when cooked. You can also use white or yellow potatoes, but their high starch content may make the potato salad a little mushy in texture.
Recipe will keep for 5 days. Store in the fridge in an air-tight container.

recipes.name: Freddy's pasta in red sauce
recipes.description: Easy to prepare vegan spaghetti and meatballs to die for.
instructions: Cut up one onion and smash 4 garlic cloves
Add olive oil to a pan cook the onions until brown
Add the garlic and bake for a minute, avoid burning them.
Add 2 spoons of tomatoe puree and one spoon of sugar
Add the 400g of pulpa and combine.
Add spices
Let this slowly cook for up to 15 minutes (longer is even better)
Boil water and cook 200g of spaghetti in water
Prepare the vegan meatball in another pan
Add the cooked spaghetti and some of the water to the sauce and combine.
Enjoy!
tips: Boil water for spaghetti after the sauce is starting to slowly cook for the 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Fresh ginger shots
recipes.description: Easy to make ginger shots recipe.
instructions: Wash the ginger root but leave the peel intact
Chop the ginger root into large chunks and place in blender
Pour in lemon juice, water, honey and turmeric.
Blend it all together
Place a fine mesh strainer over a measuring pitcher or glass, pour the contents from the blender in and use a spatula to press down on the thick pulp
Pour the strained juice left over into a glass container
tips: Use the 100ml cup and measure out your gingner roots. Then use half the amount in cups for lemon juice and water.

recipes.name: Tofu Butter Chicken
recipes.description: This dish was inspired by one of the world's most popular Indian dishes, butter chicken. We just replaced the chicken with wonderful tofu and made the recipe speedy!  Next time you're in the mood for a rich, creamy curry that's full of flavour and completely reliable, give this recipe a whirl
ingredients: Plant-based Naan bread or Roti - optional
instructions: Add 1 tablespoon of the plant-based butter to a frying pan or casserole and set over a medium-high heat
Peel and roughly chop the onion and add it to the pan with pinch of salt • Fry for 3–4 minutes, stirring occasionally
Add the spices and cook for 1 minute
Peel the garlic then grate the garlic and ginger directly into the pan
Add the tomato purée and fry for 2 minutes
Pour the passata into the pan, bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer
Leave to bubble while you make the puffs
Pour a 1cm depth of oil into the second frying pan and set it over a high heat
Pat the tofu dry with kitchen paper and tear it into bite-sized chunks
Put the cornflour and salt into a sandwich bag or Tupperware container
Add the tofu chunks and shake until the chunks are well dusted
Carefully lower the dusted tofu pieces into the hot oil and cook until golden, crispy and puffed up, increasing the heat if necessary
Remove to drain on the plate lined with kitchen paper
Heat the rice pouches in the microwave according to the packet instructions
Slice the limes into wedges
Finely slice the green chilli
Add the plant-based cream and the remaining tablespoon of plant-based butter to the pan
Season with salt and pepper
Tip the puffed tofu into the curry sauce and stir until coated
Divide the curry between bowls
Scatter with coriander leaves and green chilli
Serve with the rice, lime wedges and naans or roti, if you like

recipes.name: Glazed Stovetop Carrots
recipes.description: Carrots cooked until tender in a buttery maple and brown sugar glaze, topped with herbs and flaky salt. A simple yet elegant side dish!
ingredients: 450 g carrots, peeled and sliced into coins
instructions: Place a large skillet over medium heat and add the butter.
Once melted, add the carrots and sauté for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the maple syrup, brown sugar, salt, pepper, and cinnamon. Stir to coat the carrots.
Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for another 10–15 minutes until the carrots are tender and glazed, stirring occasionally.
Uncover and increase heat to medium-high. Cook for another 2–3 minutes to thicken the glaze.
Remove from heat. Stir in chopped herbs and sprinkle with flaky salt before serving.
tips: Cut your carrots evenly so they cook at the same rate.
Add a splash of orange juice or balsamic vinegar for extra depth.
Use vegan butter to keep the dish plant-based.

recipes.name: Baked Gnocchi with Summer Vegetables
recipes.description: A vibrant, oven-roasted gnocchi dish packed with summer vegetables, seasoned with herbs and capers, and optionally topped with vegan ricotta. Perfect for a quick and flavorful meal.
ingredients: a generous pinch of mild chilli flakes (optional)
½ tsp salt, more to taste
500 g / 17.5 oz vegan gnocchi (gluten-free if needed)
½ red onion, cut into thick wedges
1 small zucchini, sliced into thick quarters
1 tsp sugar or 1 tbsp chopped raisins
spices: a generous pinch of mild chilli flakes (optional)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 220°C / 425°F and prepare a medium-sized baking tin (approximately 22.5 cm x 30 cm).
In a mixing jug, combine olive oil, grated garlic, oregano, chilli flakes (if using), chopped capers, salt, and pepper.
Place the gnocchi in the baking tin and stir in the olive oil mixture until well coated.
Add the onion wedges and zucchini pieces to the tin and mix gently.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Add the halved cherry tomatoes, balsamic vinegar (if using), and sugar or raisins. Stir everything together.
Bake for an additional 15 minutes, then stir the contents of the tin.
Bake for a final 10 minutes.
Divide between plates and serve with dollops of vegan ricotta, if desired.
tips: Ensure the gnocchi is well coated with the olive oil mixture to prevent sticking and to enhance flavor.
Adding the tomatoes later in the baking process helps retain some of their shape and juiciness.
For a gluten-free version, ensure the gnocchi used is gluten-free.
